Fact Check: False Post Viral As PM Modi Providing Free Mobile Recharge To Get Votes In 2024 Elections

A post is being circulated online, claiming that Prime Minister Modi is giving 28 days free recharge of ₹239 to all Indians so that people vote for BJP in the upcoming 2024 general elections. The post claims that the last date to avail the offer is December 31, 2023.

Facebook users are sharing the post with the caption: "Prime Minister Narendra Modi is giving 28 days of recharge free of ₹239 to all Indian users so that in the 2024 elections maximum people can vote for BJP and form a BJP government again. I have also done my 28 days free recharge from this, you too click on the link given below to get 28 days free recharge (Last Date – 31 Dec. 2023)"

FACT CHECK

NewsMobile fact-checked the post and found the claim to be false.

Firstly, we opened the link mentioned in the viral message, which led us to a YouTube channel that had no relevant information regarding any such scheme.

We also checked the official website and Twitter accounts of PM Modi and BJP but did not find any such announcements.

We also found that the fact-checking unit of the Press Information Bureau also refuted the viral claim.

NewsMobile has previously debunked similar posts on several occasions when a similar offer was attributed to states and Central governments.

Hence, we can conclude that the viral post is clickbait, and fake.
title: Fact Check: False Post Viral As PM Modi Providing Free Mobile Recharge
vclaim: A viral post falsely claims that Prime Minister Modi is offering 28 days of free mobile recharge worth ₹239 to all Indians to gain votes for BJP in the 2024 elections.
